details.title: Eight arrested for preventing entry of women
details.content: Eight people preventing entry of women to Sabarimala were arrested by the police at Nilakkal base camp on Tuesday evening following multiple incidents of protesters stopping vehicles and forcefully sending back of women passengers. (Read)

details.title: Strict action to be taken
details.content: All the range IGs have been ordered to take strict action against anyone who disturbs traffic in the region

details.title: Ayyappa Samrakshana Samiti to intensify protests
details.content: A group, under the banner of "Ayyappa Samrakshana Samiti" is expected to intensify their protests as the Sabarimala shrine opens on Wednesday for the pilgrimage season.

details.title: Early morning protests at Nilakkal
details.content: A gathering of agitators and police deployed at Nilakkal had a heated debate at around 4.15 AM and this stand off extended for more than an hour. More police were deployed and at around 6.15 they were forced to break the gathering. (Read more)

details.title: Police remove protestors
details.content: A couple of agitators were taken into custody, while others were forcefully evicted and the protest venue was fully dismantled.
Kerala police dismantle a temporary shed made by the agitators at Nilakkal on Wednesday morning. (Photo | B P Deepu/EPS)

details.title: Security intensified
details.content:
Kerala: Total 1000 security personnel, 800 men and 200 women, deployed at Nillekal and Pampa base. 500 security personnel deployed at Sannidhanam. Portals of the #SabarimalaTemple will be opened today. pic.twitter.com/yxjJ1CCWzq

— ANI (@ANI) October 17, 2018

The Sabarimala Karma Samiti will intensify the protests in the Sabarimala issue, saying the LDF Government has “unnecessarily” created a volatile atmosphere throughout the state by rushing to implement the Supreme Court order

#Sabarimala issue #LIVE UPDATES: Nilakkal Tense as the hill shrine opens today. Here are some footages from Nilakkal. Follow the link for more updates: https://t.co/DH7BKTeleb pic.twitter.com/q6HhXXf7hs

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) October 17, 2018
Devaswom minister to hold review meeting at 11 am ahead of the Sabarimala Temple opening.
Three women police personnel reportedly stopped by Rahul Easwer, say TV reports.

#TamilNadu: Pilgrims begin arriving at Nilakkal, the base camp of #SabarimalaTemple as the portals of the temple are all set to open today. pic.twitter.com/4Fw4eYvMum

— ANI (@ANI) October 17, 2018

details.title: WATCH | What is the Sabarimala verdict all about?

details.content: I have seen fight for equality, not for slavery and inequality. On one hand, fight against atrocities by men is going on in the nation & on the other hand, women are fighting against their own freedom & rights: BJP MP Udit Raj to ANI on women protesting their entry in Sabarimala Temple.

Kerala: Protests being held near Pamba base camp against entry of women in the age group 10-50 to #SabarimalaTemple pic.twitter.com/JTZ2negQ5L

— ANI (@ANI) October 17, 2018

details.title: Sabarimala temple doors to open today at 5 pm, here's what the schedule looks like
details.content:
The door of the Lord Ayyappa shrine will open today at 5 pm and will continue the monthly rituals for the next five days in the Malayalam month of Thulam.

The Neyyabhishekom will be held on October 17, 18, and 19. The Ashtabandha Kalasom will be held at the Ayyappa temple and the Malikappuram Devi temple on 20 October. Udayasthamanapuja, Pushpabhishekom, and Padipooja will be held on all the five days before the temple closes on October 21 to be reopened next month.

details.title: It's a fight between Hindu Renaissance and Obscurantism: Swamy
details.content: Supreme Court has made a decision, but now you are saying that it's our tradition. Triple Talaq is also a tradition in that way, everybody was applauding when it was abolished. The same Hindus have come on the streets now. It's a fight between the Hindu Renaissance and the Obscurantism. Renaissance says all Hindus are equal and caste system should be abolished. Because no Brahman today is only intellectual, they're in cinema, business as well. Where is it written that caste is from birth? Shastras can be amended: Subramanian Swamy to ANI

details.title: There is a very strong police presence in and around Sabarimala: Kerala police chief Loknath Behera
details.content:
Kerala Police chief Loknath Behera said no one will be stopped from going to Sabarimala as the chief priest of the Lord Ayyappa temple announced that women from the royal and tantri families will take part in the prayers. 

[CLICK HERE TO READ FULL REPORT]

details.title: Protest against Entry of women in age group of 10-50
details.content:
#WATCH: Women protest in Nilakkal against the entry of women in the age group of 10-50 to #Sabarimala temple. #Kerala pic.twitter.com/GuxDZo0R7G

— ANI (@ANI) October 17, 2018

details.title: Protest will be strengthened: BJP state president P S Sreedharan Pillai
details.content:
LIVE | More protesters arriving at Nilakkal. More police to be deployed in the region, says state police chief Loknath Behera. Protest will be strengthened, says BJP state president P S Sreedharan Pillai. @anilsanilan reports from #Sabarimala.

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) October 17, 2018

A young woman identified as Libi from Alappuzha who came for darshan at Sabarimala blocked at Pathanamthitta bus stand and was taken to Pathanamthitta police station, reports Express correspondent Anil S Anilan.

Talking to newspersons, Libi a native of Cherthala in Alappuzha district said she came to visit Lord Ayyappa temple and could not complete the 41-day penance which is needed as part of temple customs and traditions. (Photo | Facebook)

details.title: Andhra woman blocked by protesters
details.content: Madhavi, a 45-year-old from Andhra Pradesh, went beyond Pamba and reached the Swamy Ayyappan road. But she was sent back after protesters reportedly blocked her. (Photo | TV Screengrab)

Anil C Anilan from Sabariala reports that Rahul Easwar appears to have softened his stance on the Sabarimala protests saying that the devotees will stand peacefully and pray. They will follow the Gandhian way, he said.

Pamba: Police detain people protesting against the entry of women in the age group of 10-50 women to Kerala's #SabarimalaTemple pic.twitter.com/DLdoYMVz8J

— ANI (@ANI) October 17, 2018

A TV journalist was attacked by protesters present at Nilakkal. The channel's car was also damaged, their windshield and rear bumper were smashed and their equipment was taken, according to local reports. (Photo | TV grab)
Police detain people protesting against the entry of women in the age group of 10-50 to Sabarimala at Pamba, reports ANI.

details.title: Govt trying to demolish centuries-old customs, allege tribals
details.content:
Tribals living in the hills around Sabarimala alleged that the government and the Travancore Devaswom Board were trying to demolish centuries-old customs by allowing entry of women in the 10-50 age group into the famous Sabarimala temple. They also claimed several rights of the tribal communities over the Sabarimala temple and the places associated with the hill shrine were forcibly taken away from them by the authorities of the government and the Travancore Devaswom Board that manages the temple. 

[CLICK HERE TO READ THE FULL REPORT[
Kerala DGP Loknath Behera has urgently notified all district SPs to file cases and detain the protesters on the spot.

details.title: Nobody can take away the devotees' right to take part in the pilgrimage: Devaswom Minister Kadakampally Surendran
details.content: We will not allow protestors to take the law into their hands. Nobody can take away the devotees' right to take part in the pilgrimage. Those using the Ayyappa chant as a cry of protest are insulting Lord Ayyappa and his devotees. As the Devaswom minister, I am not here to allow or block entry of women into the temple.

Saritha Balan, a News Minute reporter was surrounded and attacked by a mob of 20 men who forced her to disembark the KSRTC bus she was travelling in with other journalists. According to a TNM report, as she was given police protection, a protester kicked her on her spine and verbally abused her.

details.title: Ex-TDB chief Prayar Gopalakrishnan detained
details.content: Over 20 people including former Travancore Devaswom Board president Prayar Gopalakrishnan taken into custody in Nilakkal and Pamba for protesting against entry of women in age group 10 to 50 to Sabarimala temple.

#Nilakkal Thousands of devotees arriving from different parts of Kerala to join protest against Supreme Court verdict allowing entry of women in all age group to Sabarimala @NewIndianXpress

— ajay kanth (@ajaykanth7) October 17, 2018

details.title: Andhra woman devotee returns mid-way
details.content:
Kerala: Woman devotee Madhavi with her children returning mid-day from her journey to #SabarimalaTemple after facing protests. Police is also present. pic.twitter.com/UBYSUFtUbI

— ANI (@ANI) October 17, 2018
Hindu Aikya Vedi to continue with its protest at Nilakkal till Sabarimala temple is closed after the five day monthly Thula pooja, reports TNIE correspondent Ajay Kanth.

Total 30 people have been arrested in Pamba, 9 yesterday and 21 today, in connection with protests against entry of women in age group 10-50 to Sabarimala Temple. Two of them have been granted bail, reports ANI.

details.content:
RSS&BJP is taking double standards.On one hand,5 advocates associated with BJP gave petition in SC over entry of women of all ages in Sabarimala temple,on the other hand,BJP is leading fight against the verdict. Now BJP trying to make it as a law&order issue: VS Sunil,Kerala Min pic.twitter.com/DpNWY5gm2B

— ANI (@ANI) October 17, 2018
BJP leader, M T Ramesh says, the government and police are trying to make Sabarimala a "war zone"
Kerala police detain Rahul Easwar in Pamba. Easwar is the grandson of the former high priest of the Sabarimala Shrine.

RSS and BJP are taking double standards. On one hand, five advocates associated with BJP gave petition in SC over entry of women of all ages in Sabarimala temple, on the other hand, BJP is leading fight against the verdict. Now BJP trying to make it as a law and order issue: VS Sunil, Kerala Minister to ANI.

details.title: Forest paths to Sabarimala blocked by Hindu outfits
details.content:
A few Hindu Aikya Vedi and Ayyappa Bhakta Samajam members on Wednesday camped at the Vallakkadavu and Sathram areas, the two traditional forest paths in Idukki which the devotees use en route to Sabarimala, to prevent women devotees from entering into the temple.  

[CLICK HERE TO READ FULL REPORT]

I can predict what is going on there, I think it is intentional,it's dirty politics they (protesters) are playing. We can't say if they are actual devotees. Supreme Court's order is Constitutional & govt is bound to implement it: K K Shailaja, Kerala Minister #SabarimalaTemple pic.twitter.com/f8V73u57Lm

— ANI (@ANI) October 17, 2018
National Commission for Women takes cognizance of the attack on women journalists. A meeting is underway at NCW office for further steps to be taken: ANI

#WATCH: Police lathi-charge and pelt stones at the protesters gathered at Nilakkal base camp, in Kerala. #SabarimalaTemple pic.twitter.com/DMC1ePz0l2

— ANI (@ANI) October 17, 2018
Police resort to heavy lathicharge at Nilakkal as a group of protesting devotees turn violent and pelt stones at police personnel and other onlookers.

#WATCH: India Today journalist Mausami Singh and its crew in a police vehicle. They were attacked by the protesters at Nilakkal base camp. #SabarimalaTemple #Kerala pic.twitter.com/R7rsSBK8fx

— ANI (@ANI) October 17, 2018
The BJP and Congress have extended support to devotees who are protesting against the CPI(M)-led LDF government's decision to implement the verdict and not file a review petition.

LDF government is fully responsible for any law and order situation in state. It's a very unfortunate situation, we aren't responsible. No BJP worker is involved, we're condemning that attempt: BJP leader M S Kumar to ANI on incidents of violence at Nilakkal base camp

details.title: WATCH | This is a people's protest, says Sasikala Teacher
NWMI issues statement
details.content: Network of Women in Media, India have denounced attacks on journalists, including several women journalists, at Nilakkal and Sabarimala. The group demands that the Kerala govenment take immediate action against the agitators who let violent assailants loose on journalists.
Sabarimala Temple gates opened to devotees, women blocked.

Congress is not attacking anybody and definitely attack on journalists is not tolerable. Those who are protesting there, are BJP and RSS people. Nowhere Congress people are engaged in this kind of hooliganism or vandalism: Congress leader Ramesh Chennithala to ANI
The devotees can offer prayers till 10.30 pm today. The portals which were opened at 5 pm today will remain open till 22 October.

details.title: ANI reporter attacked by protesters
details.content: ANI reporter Karam Ingerlose was slapped by protesters, his phone was snatched and broken into pieces by them when he was shooting a video in Erumely. The protesters asked him to apologise for shooting the video and let him go only after he apologised.
Sabarimala Ayyappa Temple head priest Tantri Kandararu Rajeevaru gestures at protesting devotees on the opening day of the Sabarimala Temple in Kerala. (Photo | PTI)

10 KSRTC buses were damaged. Devotees from other states were beaten up & sent back. RSS-BJP is behind all of this.
